text: James Browne (1842–1917) was an Irish Roman Catholic clergyman who served as the Bishop of Ferns from 1884 to 1917.Bishop James Browne. Catholic Hierarchy website. Retrieved on 9 April 2010. Born in Mayglass, County Wexford, Ireland on 28 August 1842, Browne studied in Maynooth College where he was ordained to the priesthood on 25 December 1865.Diocese of Ferns New Advent. He was appointed bishop of the Diocese of Ferns on 6 July 1884 and consecrated on 14 September 1884 by James Lynch, Bishop of Kildare and Leighlin. Browne died in office on 21 June 1917, aged 74 years old. ==References== Category:1842 births Category:1917 deaths Category:People from Ferns Category:Roman Catholic bishops of Ferns Category:Post-Reformation Roman Catholic bishops in Ireland Category:Alumni of St Patrick's College, Maynooth
title: James Browne (bishop of Ferns)
